name: 1619_A. Square String?
description:
A string is called square if it is some string written twice in a row. For example, the strings "aa", "abcabc", "abab" and "baabaa" are square. But the strings "aaa", "abaaab" and "abcdabc" are not square.

For a given string s determine if it is square.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input


10
a
aa
aaa
aaaa
abab
abcabc
abacaba
xxyy
xyyx
xyxy


Output


NO
YES
NO
YES
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
YES

A string is considered square when it can be repeated twice in succession, for instance "aa", "abcabc", "abab" and "baabaa" are square whereas "aaa", "abaaab" and "abcdabc" are not square. For a given string s determine if it is square.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input

a

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

Output

Important Note: You must follow the input output format. Input must be taken from standard input and output must be given to standard output. The code will be tested against multiple test cases and all the test cases must be passed.
Write a main() function and use input() function to read input from stdin

A string is considered square when it can be repeated twice in succession, forming a longer string that is identical to the original string. For example, "aa", "abcabc", "abab", and "baabaa" are considered square strings, as they can be formed by repeating the original string. On the other hand, "aaa", "abaaab", and "abcdabc" are not square, as they cannot be formed by repeating a shorter substring. Given a string s, determine if it is square.

Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input


10
a
aa
aaa
aaaa
abab
abcabc
abacaba
xxyy
xyyx
xyxy


Output


NO
YES
NO
YES
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
YES

 # [core concept]
    'square string': A string that can be repeated twice in succession to form a new string.
    Explanation: A square string is one that, when concatenated with itself, results in the same string. For example, "abab" is a square string because "abab" + "abab" = "abababab".

    Explanation: A string is considered square if it can be formed by concatenating two identical halves of itself. For example, "abab" is square because it can be formed by concatenating "ab" with "ab".

examples:
Input

The first line of input data contains an integer t (1 ≤ t ≤ 100) —the number of test cases.

This is followed by t lines, each containing a description of one test case. The given strings consist only of lowercase Latin letters and have lengths between 1 and 100 inclusive.

Output

For each test case, output on a separate line:

  * YES if the string in the corresponding test case is square, 
  * NO otherwise. 



You can output YES and NO in any case (for example, strings yEs, yes, Yes and YES will be recognized as a positive response).

Example

Input


10
a
aa
aaa
aaaa
abab
abcabc
abacaba
xxyy
xyyx
xyxy


Output


NO
YES
NO
YES
YES
YES
NO
NO
NO
YES
